title: Sampler, 1833
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique:  embroidered in cross, long-armed cross, satin, double running, and aztec stitches (running stitch and wrapping over withdrawn elements) on plain weave foundation
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 38.1 x 69.9 cm (15 x 27 1/2 in.)
description: Three columns of geometric and floral patterned bands in many colors. Pelicans in middle of right hand column. An inscription at the top center reads Juliana Vieytez 1833.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1833.
1833. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique:  embroidered in cross, long-armed cross, satin, double running, and aztec stitches (running stitch and wrapping over withdrawn elements) on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-385.
